page.title: 01Review
page.content:
In a landscape of undulating arable farmland, dotted with small areas of woodland and isolated trees,lie the three main settlements of Swardeston, Swainsthorpe, Stoke Holy Cross, where development is still taking place and the small hamlet of Dunston.
A few people only work in the villages on the farms or in the shops. The vast majority find employment in the nearby city of Norwich, which is five to eight miles distant.
Life is quiet, and social problems are few, most of the population being employed and in reasonably comfortable situations.
Facilities and amenities are adequate.
